triples.name: Fuzzy Logic
triples.relevance: Fuzzy logic systems are used to approximate unknown nonlinear dynamics in the proposed control strategy.

triples.name: Multi-agent System
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multi-agent systems with cooperative and competitive relationships.

triples.name: Control Theory
triples.relevance: The paper develops a control strategy for adaptive formation tracking in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Nonlinear System
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multi-agent systems where fuzzy logic approximates unknown nonlinear dynamics.

triples.name: Graph Theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory concepts are used to model the directed communication topology among agents.

triples.name: Consensus Dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus mechanisms are related to formation tracking and coordination among multiple agents with communication constraints.

triples.name: Lyapunov Stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability analysis is used to prove the stability of the proposed adaptive fuzzy bipartite formation tracking control.

triples.name: Distributed Algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a distributed dynamic self-triggered control (DSTC) mechanism to improve transmission efficiency in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Adaptive Control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive fuzzy control strategy that adjusts to nonlinear dynamics and dynamically triggered control intervals.

triples.name: Cooperative Game Theory
triples.relevance: The paper addresses systems with both cooperative and competitive relationships among agents, influenced by game-theoretic principles.
